p: Agasicles hygrophila (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae) is a South American herbivore with a narrow host range ( Alternanthera) that was first released in China in 1986 to control A. philoxeroides but also attacks the non-target plant A. sessilis [ 33]. The beetle’s range has expanded to 30.8 °N in China in the past few decades, possibly in part due to increases in temperature [ 37]. Meloidogyne incognita (Tylenchida: Heteroderidae), a generalist root-knot nematode, is the most widespread and common nematode pest of agricultural and semi-natural systems in tropical and subtropical regions ( www.cabi.org/isc/datasheet/33245).
